data.message: I know this is not the appropriate area to ask but...My mother had a FB page for years...She is deceased...We posted family pictures, thoughts to her page..I thought it might keep her page current.  A few weeks back I noticed a email about deceased FB information.  I no longer have that...Can you help me to pull up her FB page?  Thank you in advance.

replies.message: We're sorry for your loss, Debbie. It is our policy to memorialize the account of a deceased person. In order to protect the privacy of the deceased person, we cannot provide login information for the account. However, once it has been memorialized, we take measures to secure the account. If you need to report a Timeline to be memorialized, please contact us here:  https://www.Facebook.com/help/contact/305593649477238?rdrhc. -Chantal

What the family does not understand is why her page is completely gone and can we bring it back.  This was the one place we all shared and getting Mom on Facebook was a challenge and comical...We would like it back..
Please someone help us...What do we need to do.  Even her comments to folks are gone.
How do i change my fb pass word?
Hi Terrence. You can learn more about how to change your password on Facebook here: http://bit.ly/1rMWDOW. Thanks! -Kate

So if someone is deceased, then memorialized by FB ( I'm assuming no one is notified of this...how does FB know of the death? ) and therefore cannot have access to login info, does this mean all the family communication, history etc that was shared is locked up forever? Seems like a big pain in the rear. What about someone trying to post funeral information?
